output.conclusion: By completing this advanced organic chemistry course, you will have a strong foundation in the principles and reactions of organic compounds, enabling you to tackle complex problems and contribute to advancements in various scientific fields.
output.introduction: Welcome to Advanced Organic Chemistry! This course delves into the intricacies of organic reactions, mechanisms, and spectroscopic analysis, building upon your existing knowledge to provide a comprehensive understanding of the subject.

chapters.description: A quick recap of atomic and molecular orbitals, hybridization, bond lengths, bond angles, and bond energies in organic molecules.
IUPAC naming conventions for complex polycyclic and heterocyclic systems, including bridged and spiro compounds.
Detailed analysis of cyclohexane derivatives, including chair conformations, steric interactions, and A-values.

chapters.chapterTitle: SN1 and SN2 Reactions: Advanced Concepts
chapters.description: In-depth exploration of factors affecting SN1 and SN2 reactions, including leaving group ability, solvent effects, and steric hindrance.

chapters.chapterTitle: E1 and E2 Reactions: Regioselectivity and Stereoselectivity
chapters.description: Zaitsev's rule vs. Hofmann's rule, stereochemical outcomes in E2 reactions, and factors favoring E1 vs. E2 mechanisms.
Detailed mechanisms of 1,2-hydride and 1,2-alkyl shifts, including examples of Wagner-Meerwein rearrangements.
1,2- vs. 1,4-addition, kinetic vs. thermodynamic control, and factors affecting regioselectivity in conjugated dienes.
Endo rule, frontier molecular orbital theory, and applications of the Diels-Alder reaction in organic synthesis.

chapters.chapterTitle: Electrophilic Aromatic Substitution: Activating and Deactivating Groups
chapters.description: Detailed analysis of substituent effects on reactivity and regioselectivity in electrophilic aromatic substitution reactions.
Acid-catalyzed and base-catalyzed aldol reactions, crossed aldol reactions, and intramolecular aldol reactions.
Mechanism of the Wittig reaction, stereoselectivity, and applications in the synthesis of complex alkenes.

chapters.chapterTitle: Grignard Reagents: Reactions with Carbonyl Compounds
chapters.description: Formation and reactivity of Grignard reagents, reactions with aldehydes, ketones, esters, and acid chlorides.
2D NMR techniques (COSY, HSQC, HMBC), interpretation of complex spectra, and applications in structure elucidation.
Common fragmentation pathways, interpretation of mass spectra, and applications in determining molecular weight and structure.
Detailed analysis of IR spectra, identification of functional groups, and applications in monitoring reaction progress.
